Title: Immigration Rules - Immigration Rules Appendix Tuberculosis (TB) - Guidance

URL Source: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-appendix-tuberculosis-tb

Markdown Content:
This appendix sets out when a person is required to provide a valid TB certificate with their application for entry clearance and the requirements for a TB certificate to be valid.

1.   TB1. A person must provide a valid TB certificate with their application if paragraph TB2 applies, and they are applying for entry clearance to come to the UK: 
    1.   (a) for more than 6 months, except for applications made under Appendix Ukraine Scheme; or
    2.   (b) as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner under Appendix FM: family members; or
    3.   (c) as a returning resident in accordance with Appendix Returning Residents.

TB2. A valid TB certificate is required if the applicant has been continuously present in a country or countries listed at TB6 for 6 months or more, which includes a period (of any length) within the 6 months before the date of application.

1.   TB3: A TB certificate is valid only if it: 
    1.   (a) was issued by a medical practitioner approved by the Secretary of State for the purpose of these rules, as listed on the Gov.uk website; and
    2.   (b) confirms that the applicant has undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in the applicant; and
    3.   (c) was issued within the 6-month period immediately before the date of application; and
    4.   (d) has not expired.

1.   TB4. A person may be required to provide a new valid TB certificate before the application for entry clearance is granted, if: 
    1.   (a) the TB certificate provided with their application expired more than 6 months before the date on which the application is considered; and
    2.   (b) the applicant otherwise meets the requirements to be granted entry clearance.

TB5. The decision maker may waive the requirement to provide a valid TB certificate if they are satisfied that the applicant is unable to obtain a certificate and it is reasonable to waive the requirement on the specific facts of the case.

1.   TB6. The list of countries for the purpose of TB2 is: 
    1.   • Afghanistan
